bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 94 (Thursday, June 7, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. VELAZQUEZ:H.R. 6048Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1``The Congress shall have Power to . . . provide for the .. . general Welfare of the United States; . . .''____________________[Page H4981]

item.name: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management Subcommittee

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.name: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

Counting Our Unexpected Natural Tragedies' Victims Act of 2018 or the COUNT Victims Act

This bill directs the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) to contract with the National Academy of Medicine to conduct a study of matters concerning best practices in mortality counts as a result of a major disaster. A report on the study must be completed and transmitted to FEMA within two years after the contract date of September 30, 2018.

The study shall address approaches to quantifying mortality and significant morbidity among populations affected by major disasters and shall include best practices and policy recommendations.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: COUNT Victims Act

item.title: To require a study and report on matters concerning best practices in mortality counts as a result of a major disaster.
Counting Our Unexpected Natural Tragedies' Victims Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
